title: 5 best bits from Arsene Wenger's Liverpool vs Arsenal press conference as Gunners boss responds to Barca job
text:
5 best bits from Arsene Wenger's Liverpool vs Arsenal press conference as Gunners boss responds to Barca job The Gunners boss was speaking ahead of his side's huge Premier League clash against Liverpool Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get Arsenal FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Arsene Wenger has been speaking ahead of Arsenal's crunch Premier League game against Liverpool on Saturday. 
The Gunners will head into the fixture having not played a competitive match for 12 days. Their last game coming against non-league Sutton United in the FA Cup fifth round. 
The fixture at Anfield will no doubt have a huge bearing on the top four come the end of the season. 
But it won't be easy for Wenger's men, Liverpool are in desperate need of a win having only won one Premier League game this calendar year. 
Here are the five best bits from Wenger's press conference: On Barcelona job? Luis Enrique will leave Barcelona at the end of the season (Photo: Getty) 
What Wenger said: "I am objective enough to make the right decision for myself and the club itself. 
"My preference [staying at Arsenal] is always the same, it will remain the same. I am not looking for jobs of other clubs or jobs of other people. 
"I am just focusing on getting to the next level and try to improve. Competent managers always try to get better, to reinvent themselves." Team news Mesut Ozil should be fit to face Liverpool (Photo: Michael Regan) 
What Wenger said: "Ramsey is back in full training and Koscielny as well. Elneny has an ankle problem." 
Will Mesut Ozil face Liverpool? 
"We’ll see,"said Wenger. "I don’t know. He should be OK." 
On Welbeck. 
"He had some ups and downs with his knee problem," said Wenger. "I followed the advice of medical people." Santi Cazorla Santi Cazorla has been absent from the Arsenal training ground (Photo: Stuart MacFarlane) 
What Wenger said: "Cazorla, I am not specialised enough [to know when he’ll be back]. It is a special problem. I have not seen him in training, not even in fitness work." 
On if he could play again this season? 
"It’s possible," said Wenger. "It’s very difficult to predict. It is very frustrating for us. At the start of the season he was the star of the team. It’s a big loss and I am very sad for him. He suffers a lot not being on the football pitch." Wanting response from players Wenger expects his men to keep fighting (Photo: Getty) 
What Wenger said: "They owe themselves a performance. 
"We responded at Sutton and we want to respond again. After that we have a chance to show Bayern we can cause them problems.” Did Gunners boss reject China job? Wenger refused to speculate (Photo: PA)
